title: Stack Patterns Quiz
description: Test LIFO reasoning and monotonic stack usage.

questions.question: Stack processing order is:
questions.explanation: Last pushed item is the first popped item.

questions.question: Balanced parentheses checking primarily needs:
questions.explanation: Most recent opening symbol must be matched first.

questions.question: In many next-greater problems, stack stores:
questions.explanation: Indices allow both value comparison and boundary calculations.

questions.question: Monotonic stack loops remain O(n) because:
options: Each element is pushed and popped at most once
questions.explanation: Total push/pop operations are linear across the pass.

questions.question: A frequent correctness check before pop is:
questions.explanation: Popping from empty stack causes invalid matching logic.

questions.question: If you need first-in first-out behavior, stack is usually:
questions.explanation: FIFO behavior is naturally modeled by queues, not stacks.
